intro: Lisianthius crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-leaved lisianthium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flower heads that are composed of numerous small florets. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax.
